comments: The transfer infor from this-

Think we should go all out for Lemar. In a midfield 3, what we need is someone like KdB/Silva/Isco, someone along those lines. A creative, nimble, hard worker and also a very good player right now but still young so has his best years to come. Matic as the holder, Pogba in front and he needs someone creative next to him. As a bonus, it would allow us to play faux 4-4-2/4-3-3 type things. Martial/Rashford would start on the left further up, but can drift inside as a second striker, while Lemar can start as a 3rd midfielder, but drift wide to act as a wide midfielder depending on situations. Would be perfect IMO. Right winger also needed, but that type also vital IMO.

Edit: The more I think about it, the more I start thinking that he could be the best possible signing we could make. We're dying for that type of midfielder and it could get the best out of Pogba by relieving some of the creative and dribbling duties in midfield, the best out of Lukaku by giving him reliable delivery, and the best out of Martial/Rashford as he can overlap them and push them inside more as second strikers where they want to be.

comments:
"The keys of Harry KaneÂ´s operation"
Madrid want to sign a galÃ¡ctico this summer and the English striker begins to be close to being the first option.
Real Madrid like Harry Kane. And each time more. And more than other galÃ¡cticos, as Neymar. The white team wants to sign a great star this summer and the name of the Tottenham striker, top scorer of 2017 in European football, has broken out with great force, according to 'SER Deportivos'.

The keys that can bring Kane closer to the BernabÃ©u are the bad relationship that exists between the club and Cristiano Ronaldo, the fact that Karim Benzema is increasingly questioned and the poor performance of Gareth Bale due to injuries.

According to AntÃ³n Meana, Neymar was preferred at the club a few months ago, but at Real Madrid they are increasingly convinced that Harry Kane can fit better in the team. Kane renewed last year for the club where he has been playing since he was 18 years old.He has a contract until 2022 and the intention of Tottenham is to continue with him many seasons. If they agreed to negotiate, the club would not accept less than 200 million â‚¬. 
 Who would leave the club in that case? There is a possibility that Cristiano does it, who wants to leave Real Madrid. Gareth Bale does not want to do it and it is not impossible for Benzema , who is marked by his poor scoring performance.

Tbh honest no one will buy Bale his wages are astronomic for a player approaching 30 and being very injury prone. Benzema is shot by the looks of it, lost his motivation to play at his dream club. Real are going to need some major surgery, so many aging stars and they're not going to be able to steal high profile players like they used to be able to do so.

comments: I know the Caf probably doesn't care about this, but this is a pretty big deal for MLS. Atlanta United has signed one of the best young talents in Argentina from Independiente for a league record fee (10.8 million pounds). Sellon percentage to Independiente for 2 seasons of 30%, after which it drops to 10%. These are the kinds of signings that are starting to transform the image of MLS. Atlanta United has come in committed to signing young talent, mostly from South America, and developing before selling them for profit to Europe. If Sanchez gets signed today as well I'll have had the perfect day.
It's a huge deal for MLS. Barco is highly rated, was a bit bemused he's gone there if i'm honest.

Very excited this finally got done. I think we'll be lucky to get a second full season out of Almiron at the rate he's going and we've got a big Yamil Asad shaped hole that needs filling, so Barco will be key.

Here's why this article falls a bit flat for me.

City haven't spent that Â£80m+ on a single player because they haven't spent big money on a forward in the last couple of years. You spend more on attackers. That isn't rocket science. 

Sane was about Â£45m I think. And he was 20-21 years old. That was huge money for him. 

They have spent absolutely massive fees for defenders. Only one other club in the world has a defender that cost over Â£50m. City are about to have 4, with Â£35m and Â£42m reserves.

So in context, City have spent huge fees relative to the positions they've bought. They got Delayed Bruyne just before things went mad and paid a pretty penny for him. Absolutely worth every penny mind. Great player. 

Â£50m for Sterling was huge as he was young, buy bs looking more and more worth it. City will have 7 players in their starting line up costing over Â£50m. We have 2, and one other who's left since.
